required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Challenge Study of Live Oral Cholera Vaccine Candidate,PXVX0200, to Prevent Cholera
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Efficacy Trial of a Single Dose Live Oral Cholera Vaccine, PXVX0200 CVD 103-HgR, in Preventing Cholera Following Challenge With Vibrio Cholerae 10 Days or 3 Months After Vaccination

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine if PXVX0200 is safe and effective in preventing cholera infection

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Efficacy Trial of a Single Dose of Live Oral Cholera Vaccine Candidate, PXVX0200 CVD 103-HgR Strain, in Preventing Cholera following Challenge with Vibrio cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba 10 Days or 3 Months after Vaccination in volunteers aged 18-45 years

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
primary_outcome.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significantly greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 10 days after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) diarrhea.

primary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
primary_outcome.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significant greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 3 months after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) of diarrhea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Weight of Diarrheal Stools Following the 10 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Total weight (converted to volume) per subject of diarrheal stools measured from subjects with diarrhea following the 10 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Weight of Diarrheal Stools Following the 90 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Total weight (converted to volume) per subject of diarrheal stools measured from subjects with diarrhea following the 90 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Diarrhea of Any Severity Following a 10 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of mild or worse (any severity) diarrhea following the 10 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Diarrhea of Any Severity Following a 90 Day Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of mild or worse (any severity) diarrhea following the 90 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Fever Following the 10 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of mild or worse fever following the 10 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Fever Following the 90 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of mild or worse fever following the 90 day cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days With Fecal Shedding Following 10 Day Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of fecal shedding of wild type V. cholerae following 10 Day Challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days With Fecal Shedding Following 90 Day Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of fecal shedding of wild type V. cholerae following 90 Day Challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: # of Days With Positive Stool Culture Following 10 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of days with a positive stool culture following the 10 Day Cholera challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: # of Days With Positive Stool Culture Following 90 Day Cholera Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of days with a positive stool culture following 90 Day Cholera Challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: % of Participants With Reactogenicity, Diarrhea, Fever or Unsolicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and severity of signs and symptoms of reactogenicity such as diarrhea, and fever following vaccination (through Day 8). Incidence and severity of unsolicited adverse events following vaccination (through Day 29).

arm_group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 5x10^8 CFU

intervention.description: Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 5x10^8

results_reference.citation: Chen WH, Cohen MB, Kirkpatrick BD, Brady RC, Galloway D, Gurwith M, Hall RH, Kessler RA, Lock M, Haney D, Lyon CE, Pasetti MF, Simon JK, Szabo F, Tennant S, Levine MM. Single-dose Live Oral Cholera Vaccine CVD 103-HgR Protects Against Human Experimental Infection With Vibrio cholerae O1 El Tor. Clin Infect Dis. 2016 Jun 1;62(11):1329-1335. doi: 10.1093/cid/ciw145. Epub 2016 Mar 21.

Haney DJ, Lock MD, Gurwith M, Simon JK, Ishioka G, Cohen MB, Kirkpatrick BD, Lyon CE, Chen WH, Sztein MB, Levine MM, Harris JB. Lipopolysaccharide-specific memory B cell responses to an attenuated live cholera vaccine are associated with protection against Vibrio cholerae infection. Vaccine. 2018 May 11;36(20):2768-2773. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2018.04.011. Epub 2018 Apr 11.

Haney DJ, Lock MD, Simon JK, Harris J, Gurwith M. Antibody-Based Correlates of Protection Against Cholera Analysis of a Challenge Study in a Cholera-Naïve Population. Clin Vaccine Immunol. 2017 May 31. pii: CVI.00098-17. doi: 10.1128/CVI.00098-17. [Epub ahead of print]

group.title: PXVX0200
group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 2x10^8 to 2x10^9 CFU in a liquid suspension

group.title: PXVX0200
group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 2x10^8 to 2x10^9 CFU in a liquid suspension

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
outcome.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significantly greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 10 days after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) diarrhea.

group.title: PXVX0200
group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 5x10^8 CFU

measure.title: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
measure.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significantly greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 10 days after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) diarrhea.

analysis.groups_desc: 35 participants were challenged 10 days after receiving PXVX0200. 66 participants were challenged either 10 days or 90 days after receiving placebo.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The lower, two sided 95% confidence bound on protective efficacy must be >/= 30%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence intervals for the protective vaccine efficacy (PE) estimates were calculated using the method of Farrington and Manning (Farrington 1990).

outcome.title: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
outcome.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significant greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 3 months after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) of diarrhea.

group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 2x10^8 to 2x10^9 CFU in a liquid suspension

measure.title: % of Participants With Moderate to Severe Diarrhea
measure.description: Determine whether a single dose of PXVX0200 provides significant greater protection than placebo against a challenge with virulent V. cholerae O1 El Tor Inaba at 3 months after vaccination. The primary endpoint was the occurrence of moderate or severe (>/= 3 liters) of diarrhea.

analysis.groups_desc: 33 participants were challenged 90 days after receiving PXVX0200. 66 participants were challenged either 10 days or 90 days after receiving placebo.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The lower, two sided 95% confidence bound on protective efficacy must be >/= 30%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence intervals for the protective vaccine efficacy (PE) estimates were calculated using the method of Farrington and Manning (Farrington 1990).

outcome.title: Total Weight of Diarrheal Stools Following the 10 Day Cholera Challenge
outcome.description: Total weight (converted to volume) per subject of diarrheal stools measured from subjects with diarrhea following the 10 day cholera challenge.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat population comprising all subjects who were randomized and received either PXVX0200 vaccine or placebo.

outcome.title: % of Participants With Reactogenicity, Diarrhea, Fever or Unsolicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
outcome.description: Incidence and severity of signs and symptoms of reactogenicity such as diarrhea, and fever following vaccination (through Day 8). Incidence and severity of unsolicited adverse events following vaccination (through Day 29).

group.title: PVXV0200
group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 2x10^8 to 2x10^9 CFU in a liquid suspension

measure.title: % of Participants With Reactogenicity, Diarrhea, Fever or Unsolicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
measure.description: Incidence and severity of signs and symptoms of reactogenicity such as diarrhea, and fever following vaccination (through Day 8). Incidence and severity of unsolicited adverse events following vaccination (through Day 29).

reported_events.time_frame: Unsolicited adverse events were recorded for each vaccine or placebo recipient from the day of vaccination through 28 days after vaccination or 28 days after challenge, whichever was later. SAEs and medically attended AEs were recorded through the end of the follow-up period (Day 181).

group.title: PVXV0200
group.description: Biological: PXVX0200 Single dose; liquid suspension after reconstitution with buffer; 5x10^8 CFU.

event.description: Placebo recipient 03019 developed potentially life-threatening hyperkalemia 3 days post-challenge and was considered unrelated to vaccination.
Placebo recipient 01047 was hospitalized for orthopedic surgery considered unrelated to vaccination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
